intro: Diplusodon rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leafed diplusodon, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Paraguay. Diplusodon rotundifolius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
